screensframework

Class TextFileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • screensframework.TextFileManager

  • public class TextFileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the various text files of the application by reading their contents and storing them inside ArrayLists for usage from other classes.
    Author:
    mark

      • inputStreamFromFile

        public static java.io.InputStream inputStreamFromFile(java.lang.String path)
        Gets an input stream from a specified filepath.

        Returns:
        Input from a file as an Input Stream

      • getSeatInformation

        public static java.lang.String[][] getSeatInformation(java.lang.String id)
                                               throws org.json.JSONException,
                                                      java.io.IOException
        Gets the seating information for a specified listing.
        Parameters:
        id - Listing ID for a particular listing
        Returns:
        A 2-dimensional array of information about the availability of seats. If the seat is free, its value will be "Free". If the seat is booked, its value will be the User ID of the user who has booked it.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - the JSON object cannot be found.
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.

      • updateUserDetails

        public static void updateUserDetails(User user)
                              throws org.json.JSONException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Rewrites the database with new information for a user whose details will be updated
        Parameters:
        user - Customer whose details are to be updated
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - the JSON object cannot be found.
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.

        public static void registerNewUser(User user)
                            throws org.json.JSONException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Adds a new Customer to the database.
        Parameters:
        user - the Customer to be added.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the JSON object cannot be found.
        java.io.IOException - if the database file cannot be found.

      • updateListing

        public static void updateListing(Listing listing)
                          throws org.json.JSONException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Updates an existing listing with new seat information (normally after a customer has made a new booking and seating changes must reflect this)
        Parameters:
        listing - the Listing to be updated
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.
        org.json.JSONException - the JSON object cannot be found.

      • removeBooking

        public static void removeBooking(User user,
                                 java.lang.String listingID)
                          throws org.json.JSONException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Removes a specified booking from the User's history
        Parameters:
        user - The User whose booking should be removed
        listingID - The ID for the listing to be removes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.
        org.json.JSONException - the JSON object cannot be found.

      • seatToCoordinate

        public static java.lang.String seatToCoordinate(java.lang.String seat)
        Converts a 'nice' String representation of a seat to numbered coordinates for ease-of-use in the database.
        Parameters:
        seat - A String in the form "Seat A7"
        Returns:
        The coordinates of a booking of the form "Seat A7". In this case the returned value would be "06", since Seat A7 is in row 0 and column 6.

      • addFilmDetails

        public static void addFilmDetails(Movie newMovie)
                           throws org.json.JSONException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Adds a new film as a JSONObject to the database file.
        Parameters:
        newMovie - the new film to be added.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.
        org.json.JSONException - the JSON Object cannot be found.

      • addFilmListings

        public static void addFilmListings(Listing newListing)
                            throws org.json.JSONException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Adds a new film listing as a JSONObject to the database. The seats are stored as 60 "Free" key:value pairs.
        Parameters:
        newListing - the new listing to be added.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.
        org.json.JSONException - the JSON Object cannot be found.

      • loginDetailsToArrayList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> loginDetailsToArrayList()
                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Takes the Login Details from the database and inserts them into an Array List.
        Returns:
        An array of login details for users of the cinema booking system. The array columns signify email-address/username, password and a staff/customer choice that tells the system to point the user in the correct direction.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.

      • filmListToArrayList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> filmListToArrayList()
                                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Takes the Film List from the database and returns it in Array List format.
        Returns:
        The list of films, their img URLs and descriptions in an array list.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.

      • filmTimesToArrayList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> filmTimesToArrayList()
                                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Takes the Film Times from the database and returns them in an Array List format.
        Returns:
        The list of film showings in an array list. Each film has a collection of dates and times attributed to it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.

      • filmsFilteredByDate

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> filmsFilteredByDate(java.lang.String date)
                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Filters the list of films by a selected date.
        Parameters:
        date - in the format dd/MM/yyyy
        Returns:
        A list of film titles that are playing on a specified date
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.

      • timesFilteredByDateAndFilm

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> timesFilteredByDateAndFilm(java.lang.String date,
                                                                          java.lang.String film)
                                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Filters the available times for a given film and date.
        Parameters:
        date - Date of the film listing
        film - Title of the film listing
        Returns:
        All times that this film is showing on this date
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the database file cannot be found.
